body_html: gen_git_source.py should work in Python 3 and Python 2. It used to not have the b" prefixes on the string literals, but @mrry added them for Windows compatibility. Looking, but the easiest work around is to just edit gen_git_source.py to remove the b" in the string literals.
body_text: gen_git_source.py should work in Python 3 and Python 2. It used to not have the b"  prefixes on the string literals, but @mrry added them for Windows compatibility. Looking, but the easiest work around is to just edit gen_git_source.py to remove the b" in the string literals.
body: gen_git_source.py should work in Python 3 and Python 2. It used to not have the b"  prefixes on the string literals, but @mrry added them for Windows compatibility. Looking, but the easiest work around is to just edit gen_git_source.py to remove the b" in the string literals.
